title: Verb patterns: gerund or infinitive - 4
instructions: Complete the sentences with the verbs. Use the B1gerundB2 or the B1to-infinitiveB2.

sentence: (wait) in front of this shop any more.
explain: Corr: to wait. After 'want' we use the to-infinitive.
Corr: to buy. After 'afford' we use the to-infinitive.
Corr: to drive. After 'learn' we use the to-infinitive.

sentence: (put) my umbrella in my bag, so I didn’t get wet in the rain.
explain: Corr: to put. After 'remember' we use the to-infinitive if we express that we did sg because we hadn't forgotten it.
Corr: to give. After 'mean' we use the to-infinitive if it means 'intend' or 'want'.
Corr: jogging. After 'give up' we use the gerund.
Corr: speaking. After 'practise' we use the gerund.
